action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the sandwich in the freezer, the plate on the shelf and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a bed and a wardrobe. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The wardrobe is now open. In the wardrobe there is a pillow.
You take the pillow. In your inventory you have a pillow.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a refrigerator and a counter. The cupboard is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a banana, a peach, a sandwich, a apple and a orange.
You take the sandwich. In your inventory you have a sandwich and a pillow.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You are in a broom closet now. There are a mop and a broom. The mop is on the floor. The broom is on the floor. There is a passage to a hallway here.
Your inventory can not hold more than two objects at the same time.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
I don't know how to interpret this 'leave' action.
You can't see a floor here.
> place pillow in the broom closet
You are not in a broomcloset.
You are already in the broom closet.
> place pillow on the floor of the broom closet
I don't know how to interpret this 'place' action.
> drop pillow in the broom closet
You are not in a broomcloset.
You are already in the broom closet.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
You can't see a floor here.
> put pillow in the broom closet
You are not in a broomcloset.
You are already in the broom closet.
> put pillow on the floor of the broom closet
I don't know what you mean.
> leave pillow in the broom closet
You are not in a broomcloset.
You are already in the broom closet.
> drop pillow in the broom closet
You are not in a broomcloset.
You are already in the broom closet.
